bug.author: jlewi
bug.description:
We are now on 0.7.0RC7 for kfctl <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases</denchmark-link>
There are currently no known P0 issues. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/orgs/kubeflow/projects/22?card_filter_query=label%3Apriority%2Fp0>https://github.com/orgs/kubeflow/projects/22?card_filter_query=label%3Apriority%2Fp0</denchmark-link>
Opening this bug to track qualifying the kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml config. Ideally we'd like to aim to finalize 0.7.0 today. So it would be great to do run through the deployment and identify and fix any issues that come up. There was a bug <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4415>#4415</denchmark-link> with the registration flow in the case with no identity. We'd like to verify that issue has been fixed. Related to: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4249>#4249</denchmark-link>
/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/krishnadurai>@krishnadurai</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.68. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

There was a bug #4415 with the registration flow in the case with no identity. We'd like to verify that issue has been fixed.
This is fixed. Just verified with a fresh deployment with the newest RC.

What I've verified with this configuration:
Central Dashboard seems fine and #4415 is fixed now. Notebooks and profiles are accessible and functional as intended Pipelines seem to be working fine Katib's random experiment example ran into this issue:
<denchmark-code>kubectl logs -n kubeflow random-experiment-random-868cd68f9b-8whsf INFO:hyperopt.utils:Failed to load dill, try installing dill via "pip install dill" for enhanced pickling support. INFO:hyperopt.fmin:Failed to load dill, try installing dill via "pip install dill" for enhanced pickling support. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/johnugeorge>@johnugeorge</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gaocegege>@gaocegege</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hougangliu>@hougangliu</denchmark-link> Is this expected behaviour OTS?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/krishnadurai>@krishnadurai</denchmark-link>
for katib, it works fine, you can ignore the INFO.

kubectl logs -n kubeflow random-experiment-random-868cd68f9b-8whsf INFO:hyperopt.utils:Failed to load dill, try installing dill via "pip install dill" for enhanced pickling support. INFO:hyperopt.fmin:Failed to load dill, try installing dill via "pip install dill" for enhanced pickling support.
The katib tests passed.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> the RCs look good. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/4452>#4452</denchmark-link> is a cherry-pick which needs to be merged in.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/krishnadurai>@krishnadurai</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
/close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
